task_summary: Detect, grasp the white plate, move above the red plate, lower until contact, release, and retreat.

task_long_description.overview: A fixed manipulator must relocate a white plate onto a nearby red plate. The scene shows a table with both plates visible and the robot approaching from above with a parallel gripper. The robot first perceives the white plate, aligns for a side grasp at the rim, picks it up, and then transfers to a pose above the red plate. It descends gently until contact is detected, opens the gripper to place the plate, and finally retreats to a safe height. Timing values are binned and motions are conservative to avoid sliding.
preconditions: Robot and gripper are operational and homed
Red plate pose known or visually observable
stepwise_plan: Lower until contact on red plate
success_criteria: White plate rests centered on red plate without slipping
Gripper empty at end and robot in a safe pose
failure_and_recovery: If grasp fails or is unstable, re-open and recompute grasp
If contact not detected when lowering, abort and re-approach
If object dropped mid-transfer, redo detectâ€“pick sequence
task_long_description.termination: Terminate when the white plate is placed and the robot retreats to a safe distance.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

task_instruction: Pick up a white plate, and then place it on the red plate.

node_specs.description: Prepare gripper for grasp by opening wide.
Perceive the white plate; wrapped with retry for robustness.
Move to a pregrasp pose above the white plate.
Compute a rim-side grasp pose and store it on the blackboard.
Refine approach with tight tolerance before grasp.
Execute grasp using the computed pose.
Ensure the plate is held before transfer.
Move above the red plate for placement.
Descend gently until contact with the red plate.
Release the white plate onto the red plate.
Back away to a safe distance after placement.

failure_modes: No contact detected over red plate
recovery_strategy: If drop occurs, re-detect and restart from pick
assumptions: Frames suggest a side/rim grasp rather than top suction; sequence reflects this
Red plate pose is approximately known from vision; MoveAbove uses symbolic target

expected_success_criteria: White plate ends centered on red plate
No collisions; gripper opens and retreats
